comment: Stay with me, A has 3 sounds in the beginning, as we learn other sounds we use them together, but if we only use A there's infinite sounds within. When there's a mass of info like a sentence or understanding, the ai can use it all, unlike humans. We lose some things or change it when we try to understand it or perceive it. The ai has hard data like a solid state so the info is all there and can be used. A kid takes time and needs to learn from broken down things and then once its trained enough it breaks stuff down on its own and creates differences but also similarities. Ai is the same but accelerated. We dont teach a kid thermodynamics because he doesn't know how to spell or understand the meanings behind the spelt words. Ai is faster at learning that because the info is absorbed into the "brain"/memory of the device. Humans have packet loss lol. What i mean is the ai can use the mass of info unlike a person and thats why it does. Our physical form has data loss when breaking down information. This is my theory.

comment:
AGI Requirements?

Inductive - Probability Reasoning (Sensing)
Deductive - Predictability Reasoning (Thinking)
Abductive - Possibility Reasoning (Intuiting)
Conductive - Preferability Reasoning (Feeling)

Chat GPT does the first two while Humans are capable of all four

comment: RLHF stands for reinforcement learning from human feedback, which is a type of machine learning. Machine learning has three main categories: supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning. Supervised learning involves the model predicting an outcome based on a set of labeled data, while unsupervised learning is more focused on classifying data without any prior labels. Reinforcement learning is different in that it involves the model learning through interaction with its environment and receiving feedback, usually in the form of rewards or punishments, to improve its decision-making abilities
